title: Wesseling on British and Indian Textiles MCQ 1

content.question: The economic statistics cited by Wesseling in the first paragraph are most likely intended to illustrate which aspect of the nineteenth-century global context?

choices.label: The deteriorating working conditions of British industrial workers
The growing demand for calicoes and other Indian textiles in Britain
The role of British imperial policy in reversing the development of Indian textile manufacturing
The spread of socialist ideology in the colonies in response to European economic exploitation

content.answer: The role of British imperial policy in reversing the development of Indian textile manufacturing

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
